title: Abrskili Cave
about: The Abrskili cave is located in Abkhazia, Ochamchire Municipality, in the Mokvi river basin, in the southern foothills of the Kodori ridge, at 260 meters above sea level. It is a 2 km long underground gorge with several wide halls. The Abrskili Cave stands out with its beauty and makes an indelible impression on the visitors. Here you can find a variety of dripping formations, stalagmites, columns, drapery formations and much more. Particularly noteworthy are the halls with curteins - the halls of the meander and Abrskili. The total length of the main tunnel and its branches is up to 3 km. In the process of exploring the cave, 360 meters from the entrance, the bones of a cave bear were discovered, which became extinct about 15,000 years ago.
